frame.name: Supply
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Supplier</fen> gives a <fen>Theme</fen> to a <fen>Recipient</fen> to fulfill a need or purpose (<fen>Imposed_purpose</fen>) of the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>Habituating the ground nesting chimp groups is done by <t>provisioning</t> <fex name="Recipient">them</fex> <fex name="Theme">with sugar cane</fex>. <fex name="Supplier">CNI</fex> <fex name="Imposed_purpose">INI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Supplier">I</fex> have <t>equipped</t> <fex name="Recipient">my leech troopers</fex> <fex name="Theme">with tiny subspace displacement thingummies</fex>. <fex name="Imposed_purpose">INI</fex></ex>
<ex> She sat down on her bed, carefully folding her clothing and packing it into <fex name="Theme">the small carryall</fex> <fex name="Supplier">Starfleet</fex> had <t>provided</t> <fex name="Recipient">her</fex> <fex name="Imposed_purpose">for the journey</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Supplier
FE.definition: <def-root>The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen>. <ex>I approve of <fex name="sup">your</fex> having <t>supplied</t> him with a file of soldiers.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>VESID also <t>supplied</t> <fex name="rec">him</fex> with an all zone bus pass to help him travel to interviews.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The object that is given to the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
<ex>Cromwell merged men from multiple regiments into a single one and <t>provisioned</t> them <fex name="Thm">with red uniforms</fex> to replace their former regiment colors. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>The Harpley was launched in Launceston on the 2nd February, 1847, and with the exception of her chain cables, was <fex name="Place">there</fex> <t>supplied</t> with all her materials and stores.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for which the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>Jesus <t>equipped</t> them <fex name="Explanation">because if they tried to do it in their own strength they would have understood defeat in a whole new way</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>In Breidbach, water tankers were <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex> <t>supplied</t> to the community as the main water supply pipe had been washed away.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>Some financial support can be <t>provided</t> <fex name="Purp">in order to help you and MPI with the product approval process in an efficient and effective way</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Supplier</fen> acquires or gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>Euell <t>provisioned</t> them <fex name="Mns">by foraging, hunting, and trapping whenever his father was away</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the supplying event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Supplier</fen> that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
<ex> PandG <fex name="Man">secretly</fex> <t>provided</t> Schwartz with several boxes of documents.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> are the conditions under which the <fen>Theme</fen> is supplied.
<ex><fex name="Supplier">I</fex> <t>supplied</t> <fex name="Theme">the food</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">free of charge</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Imposed_purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Recipient</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>God gave them the promise of victory and <t>equipped</t> them <fex name="Imp">for the battle</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period over which the <fen>Supplier</fen> engages in (multiple) supplying acts.
<ex>Our company has <t>supplied</t> nations with voting machines <fex name="per">since 2000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cotheme
FE.definition:
<def-root>An additional theme which is supplied along with the main <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>Several cables were <t>provided</t> <fex name="cot">with the printer</fex>, but I'm not sure which ones to use.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The source of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>We <t>equipped</t> them <fex name="sou">from our own supply of equipment</fex>.</ex></def-root>
